widgets_values:
Framerate can be adjusted, just make sure you are using the same framerate in your VideoCombine node to see proper playback.

60FPS = Lower quality, more motion
24 FPS = Higher quality, less motion

We generate at a base resolution of 768x512.
The video will be upscaled later to FHD.
Presets override the values inside ðŸ…›ðŸ…£ðŸ…§ STG Guider Advanced node.
Depending on the latent upscaler model used, it can increase either spatial or temporal resolution, without moving to/from pixel space.

If you are not constrained in VRAM, run 1x1 tile starting from step 18 
If you are constrained in your available VRAM, run 2x2 tiles and use somewhat lower noies levels, starting from step 23.

The Advanced STG Guider dynamically controls the diffusion model's denoising process by mapping sigma values to specific configuration parameters (CFG scale, STG scale/rescale factors, and attention layer skipping patterns), enabling precise control at different denoising stages independently of step numbers while supporting additional techniques like CFG-Zero rescaling and threshold-based noise prediction zeroing.
One thing i noticed is, that if you prompt static image or something like that it moves the camera, you might test it out but in my testing it worked out best if I didnt mention the camera at all (;

Here you can disable the two upscaler phases if you only want the "low res" video generation. This is no standalone upscaler though!

If you enable them, make sure to test out what tile size is working for your vram size.
To enable I2V just actvate the load image node

-Change the model name in Unet Loader (GGUF) to the one you downloaded

-LTXQ8 Patch is not needed!

-Download the ltxv-13b-0.9.7-vae-BF16.safetensors file from here:
https://huggingface.co/wsbagnsv1/ltxv-13b-0.9.7-dev-GGUF/blob/main/ltxv-13b-0.9.7-vae-BF16.safetensors

-Enable the Distorch Loader to load bigger quants and prevent out of memory errors with 10-15gb or so virtual vram depending on your system memory (32gb you can easily set it to 14) For systems with only 16gb this might cause issues.

!!! Only enable one Loader !!!

You can select any t5 encoder, but t5 v1.1 seems to be the best, but feel free to test other options. You can select .saftensors and .ggufs here.

!!! Only enable one Clip !!!

Add loras below

nodes.title: CLIP Text Encode (Negative Prompt)
widgets_values: low quality, worst quality, deformed, distorted, disfigured, motion smear, motion artifacts, fused fingers, bad anatomy, weird hand, ugly
Best use descriptive prompt, but you can even leave it empty in i2v case.

Enable I2V Mode to use Image to video and load an image here ->

Enable these Optimizations to get a good speedup, if you encounter any issues disable them, 
for the Sage Attention on you need to install Sage attn. For Windows Portable users put this batch file:
 
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1FBYF9_ShdD8H8CRlXKDQ29rnzjuT4MYo/view?usp=sharing

in the ComfyUI_windows_portable root folder where 
run_nvidia_gpu.bat is. Then run it and it should install it for you.

The Teacache might be broken. And you might need to change the mode in the sage attention node if you have an rtx30 or lower.

FP16 Accumulation only works with torch 2.7 or higher. If you are unsure, just try to enable it, if it errors, just disable it. Gives basically a free speedup too without any real quality drop.
To enable I2V just actvate the For normal 13b use 30 for distilled use 4-10 (best is 8 imo)

nodes.title: Instructions on how to use Loras
widgets_values:
To use loras you need to disable Torchcompile, it might work some times but most of the times that break them.

Also to use loras you might need to load them the first time, that will throw errors in the console and is expected, just wait until it generated the full video (which wont contain the lora effect) and unload models and cache with comfyui manager, then start generating again and it should work. A restart might work too, just test around a bit. 

For convenience here is the disable torchcompile switch:

crop decides if the conditioning image(s) is center-cropped or resized by stretching 

crf and blur are preprocessing parameters for conditioning image(s) to make them look more like video frames, which helps with the dynamicity of the generated video

Change the fps and duration of the video in here ->

nodes.title: CLIP Text Encode (Positive Prompt)
widgets_values:
This charming image captures a pair of beautifully distinctive ducks peacefully gliding across calm waters. The left duck stands out with its deep magenta plumage, crowned by an elegant crest and sporting a vibrant yellow-green beak. Its companion contrasts perfectly with a glossy black head, bright yellow beak, and striking speckled white-and-brown body feathers.  

The warm, softly blurred background of water and shoreline creates a tranquil atmosphere, while the composition's careful balance â€“ placing the ducks slightly below center with generous water space â€“ enhances the sense of serene movement. Their vivid colors pop against the muted tones of the environment, forming a harmonious celebration of waterfowl diversity and nature's quiet moments.  

This would make a wonderful reference for bird enthusiasts, artists seeking color inspiration, or anyone appreciating the quiet beauty of wetland ecosystems. The detailed plumage patterns are particularly noteworthy for ornithological study or artistic observation.
